configuration.stem:
Most fossil evidence of flowering plants is limited to grains of pollen. Why might it be
rare for a complete plant fossil, such as this one, to form? Select all that apply.

feedBack.firstWrongHint: Flowering plants were plentiful 50 million years ago. Think about the conditions necessary for fossils to form.
feedBack.finalWrongHint: The petals and foliage of plants are soft, and it is very rare for conditions to be just right for a full plant to become fossilized.

options.name: mc-opt-item-028151441155932844
options.text: There were not many plants 50 million years ago.

options.name: mc-opt-item-06761015402153134x1
options.text: Wind or water can carry soft plant parts away before they fossilize.

options.name: _widget_-019733211384371918
options.text: Dry environments cause plants to decay too slowly to fossilize.

options.name: _widget_-08140181075464747
options.text: Flower parts are delicate and rarely experience the conditions needed to fossilize.
